items.sentence: What did you promise Tom that you'd buy for him?
I don't think the situation will get any better.
This church has beautiful stained glass windows.
I can't thank Tom enough for what he did for me.
We tend to eat more when more food is available.
I can't start my day without seeing the sunrise.
I want you to go to Boston with me next weekend.
I can probably do that in less than three hours.
I only work on weekends if absolutely necessary.
If I'd noticed the problem, I would've told you.
The woman sitting on the sofa is my grandmother.
The studio is very small, with no place to hide.
Tom hung his jacket on the back of the armchair.
There wasn't any money left in Tom's piggy bank.
As I explained yesterday, I won't be doing that.
I should probably stop eating so much junk food.
I should probably go over to Tom's and help him.
I decided to go, even though I was asked not to.
If you go to the party, I think you'll have fun.
This is the first time I've ever seen a raccoon.
